node.title: Just in the Nick of Time, a Connection
node.alt: Samantha Fleischman, left, and Allison Saltstein.
node.description: Samantha Fleischman and Allison Saltstein spent three years at Muhlenberg College before meeting in January 2010, during Ms. Saltsteinâ€™s final semester.
node.content: ["Samantha Fleischman and Allison Saltstein overlapped for three years at Muhlenberg College, a tiny liberal arts school in Allentown, Pa. But they didn\u2019t meet until Ms. Saltstein was a second-semester senior, in January 2010, and the two took the same video production class.", "\u201cTime almost ran out on us,\u201d said Ms. Saltstein, 34, who graduated with a double major in political science and Spanish, and later received a law degree from Fordham.", "\u201cI asked if I could be her partner on a project that had just been assigned,\u201d added Ms. Saltstein, now a fifth-year associate at the law firm Proskauer Rose in New York.", "Despite having never met Ms. Saltstein, Ms. Fleischman, 32, accepted her offer. After that, Ms. Fleischman said, \u201cwe became fast friends and then very close friends.\u201d They realized their paths had not crossed sooner because they traveled in different social circles on campus.", "Ms. Saltstein played on the women\u2019s softball team and studied abroad in Spain.", "Ms. Fleischman, who was a second-semester junior when they met, joined the Delta Zeta sorority, studied abroad in London and served as a writing mentor during her time at Muhlenberg, from which she graduated magna cum laude. She now works as a strategic marketing lead at TripAdvisor, an online travel company, in New York", " ", "Once they connected, though, they became inseparable, and were often seen studying for midterms in the library or working on programs in the computer lab.", "\u201cWe bonded over our love of family and friends,\u201d Ms. Fleischman said. \u201cWe\u2019re both very family-oriented, we both really love to travel and we\u2019re both huge foodies.\u201d", "Of Ms. Fleischman, Ms. Saltstein added, \u201cShe has my sense of humor and I admired her kindness.\u201d", "The two went from being close friends to a couple in the summer of 2010, shortly after Ms. Saltstein graduated. By the winter of 2011, each had declared their love for the other.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "\u201cAllison is my best friend and she is also my partner, I\u2019ve never had that before,\u201d Ms. Fleischman said. \u201cShe\u2019s the first person I want to tell everything to, the good and the bad.\u201d", "Ms. Saltstein said she felt much the same. \u201cThere was never a time when I wanted to be without Samantha because I get a sense of joy every time I\u2019m with her, which is just about all of the time,\u201d she said.", "Nine years after they officially started to date, the two became engaged, in August 2019. Ms. Fleischman proposed privately to Ms. Saltstein in their Brooklyn apartment, in Brooklyn Heights, and arranged for their immediate families to meet them at a nearby restaurant to celebrate.", "\u201cAllison has taught me to love every moment of my life and to surround myself with those who love me,\u201d Ms. Fleischman said, \u201cbecause you never know what is going to happen in this world.\u201d", "Of the proposal, Ms. Fleischman added, \u201cshe knew we were getting engaged, but she didn\u2019t know when, where or how.\u201d", "The couple married Nov. 20 before Rabbi Joshua Stanton and 164 fully vaccinated guests at Liberty Warehouse in Brooklyn.", "Among the guests were Ms. Saltstein\u2019s mother, Susan Saltstein of Long Beach Island, N.J., and Ms. Fleischman\u2019s parents, Peter Fleischman, a retired management consultant in the information technology industry, and Susan Klebanoff, a clinical psychologist and psychoanalyst in private practice in New York.", "\u201cLooking back at the 10 years that we have been together,\u201d Ms. Fleischman said, \u201cthe only thing I would do differently is propose to Allison a lot sooner.\u201d"]
